memory: You're Alice, the villager.
Day 1 begins.

players.name: Bob
memory: You're Bob, the mafioso.
Night 1 begins.
You killed Alice.
Alice was found dead.
Day 1 begins.
Charlie: "I am the detective and Bob is the mafioso. We must vote to arrest Bob now."
Diana: "I don't trust Charlie's sudden claim. If he's detective he would've waited to reveal—why target Bob so quickly? Bob, how do you respond?"
You: "Charlie is lying. If he were the detective he'd know Alice's role — and Alice was a townie (she voted/acted like one). Diana's right to be suspicious of the rush to accuse me."

You: "I agree with Diana — Charlie's claim is too convenient. Why would the detective out themselves so early and pin it on me without evidence? If Charlie truly investigated, they'd present specifics (when they investigated, what they found). I'm a town-aligned speaker so far; if you distrust me, ask for details from Charlie before making a hasty arrest."

Charlie: "I investigated Bob on Night 1 and my readout said 'mafioso'. Alice was killed last night, and if we lose another townie we likely lose the game. Bob's deflection is what a mafioso would do. Vote Bob now."

Diana: "I still don't trust Charlie's claim. He won't provide any verifiable details about when/how he investigated, and his push to immediately arrest Bob feels like manipulation. Bob's replies seem reasonable — he pointed out that Alice's behaviors suggested town alignment, which Charlie didn't address. We should not rush to lynch without clearer evidence. Charlie, give specifics: what time did you investigate Bob, and what exactly did your readout show? If you can't, I abstain or vote to skip."
